turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The Normans (TV series).
turn.1: What is the TV series The Normans about?
turn.2: The Normans (TV series) The Normans is a British television documentary series first aired on BBC Two from 4 to 18 August 2010.
turn.4: Over three episodes , it sees Professor Robert Bartlett's journey from Great Britain via Jerusalem to the Kingdom of Sicily to examine the expansion and ambition of the Normans between the 10th and 13th centuries.
turn.5: What is the most interesting fact about the series?
turn.6: In the first episode of an exciting three-part series, Professor Robert Bartlett explores how the Normans developed from a band of marauding Vikings into the formidable warriors who conquered England in 1066.
turn.7: Did you learn anything else interesting from the series?
turn.8: He tells how the Normans established their new province of Normandy - land of the northmen - in northern France.
turn.9: What did they do after they conquered England?
turn.10: They went on to build some of the finest churches in Europe and turned into an unstoppable force of Christian knights and warriors, whose legacy is all around us to this day.
turn.11: What happened to the Normans after they established Normandy?
turn.12: Under the leadership of Duke William, the Normans expanded into the neighbouring provinces of northern France.
